## Description {#details}

This file implements an ordered container of stages that simulate the pipeline of a hardware backend.

<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca">mca</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/hweventlistener">HWEventListener</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A pipeline for a specific subtarget.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It emulates an out-of-order execution of instructions. Instructions are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fetched from a MCInst sequence managed by an initial &#39;Fetch&#39; stage.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instructions are firstly fetched, then dispatched to the schedulers, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// then executed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class tracks the lifetime of an instruction from the moment where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// it gets dispatched to the schedulers, to the moment where it finishes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// executing and register writes are architecturally committed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In particular, it monitors changes in the state of every instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in flight.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instructions are executed in a loop of iterations. The number of iterations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is defined by the SourceMgr object, which is managed by the initial stage</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the instruction pipeline.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The Pipeline entry point is method &#39;run()&#39; which executes cycles in a loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// until there are new instructions to dispatch, and not every instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// has been retired.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Internally, the Pipeline collects statistical information in the form of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// histograms. For example, it tracks how the dispatch group size changes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// over time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/pipeline"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">Pipeline &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> State &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Created, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pipeline was just created. The default state.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Started, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pipeline has started running.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Paused   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pipeline is paused.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlight">  State CurrentState = State::Created;</span></CodeLine>
